Package players

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • players.Player
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PlayerPlay, Effect
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AI, PhysicalPlayer

    public abstract class Player
extends java.lang.Object
implements Effect, PlayerPlay
    Abstract class that defines all general characteristics of a player. This is where the actions of the effects are defined (excepting the change of color) and where the interface for a player is implemented.
    Author:
    Benjamin Héroult

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      boolean wantToQuit
      True if the user wants to quit.

      • addCardToTake

        public void addCardToTake​(int number)
        Adds a certain number of cards to pick for the player, the next time he will have to play. Used in cases of penalties.
        Parameters:
        number - the number of cards to pick

        public boolean executeEffect​(Card card_to_play,
                             Game game)
        Description copied from interface: Effect
        Verifies if the card has an effect affected, and if so, execute this effect.
        Specified by:
        executeEffect in interface Effect
        Parameters:
        card_to_play - the card that might have an effect
        game - used to call effects, mainly to defines the next player
        Returns:
        if the player finished his turn, true ; false if he must replay
